document.title: DYNAMIC LEARNING MAPS ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR English Language Arts

5BB4983B68754FEFBC1E49710487B214.description:
Use words acquired through conversations,
being read to, and during shared reading activities.

0C9CE54EE00A4939AA660CE147235BA8.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the meaning of common
verbs.

00C0EB5812904DCDBB512EE878E8181B.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their
use (e.g., happy: “I am happy.”).

0E67B95409094B9E98DD774CF3F7E06C.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word
relationships and use.

BBAAF3874A7C42E6B52ADFF48453FF8B.description: Identify the words comprising compound words.

CC1DC56ADA6A4CB98A77DA4B57E29C4B.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of new vocabulary drawn from
reading and content areas.

7C19981F5417428AB9BB94F311FB4AE5.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes
when communicating.

8E674118692744E08A751EF2A0D06FA4.description:
Consult print in the environment to support reading and
spelling.

159E27B4761E4AC294111E27ABC28DC0.description:
Identify printed rhyming words with the same spelling
pattern.

B3A92BEB0D654311A49199B13786C093.description:
With guidance and support, capitalize the first letter of
familiar names.

91D50E4F32FB45CA9A66BD0FF791A783.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of
conventions of standard English.

63DD4F4AD5E5465E8C721C8A50B10B50.description: Combine two or more words together in communication.

A0EC3A0B9D0B4CE09AF4106C4CC64B41.description:
Use frequently occurring pronouns to refer to self and
others (e.g., we, they, him, her, them).

EEC46C0F455F40529963CA420B278AD9.description:
Use common nouns (e.g., mom, dad, boy, girl) in
communication.

92A3039B05BE4EA0BF18D30AF53F41CC.description:
Demonstrate understanding of letter and word
use.

1B9A5C72AD06472B9C7D14003427FEFF.description:
Combine words when communicating to
provide clarification.

3C86A761A91142E8BBC7C85428A5144A.description:
Select visual, audio, or tactual representations
to depict a personal experience.

50FE4F28FA14490F8E5F3D6E708BA481.description:
Identify a photograph or object that reflects a
personal experience and tell one detail about it.

B4AAE11ABF234FFC8FD04D7C3D7D56C3.description:
Answer questions about the details provided by
the speaker.

5A8406B08EF3425B84E0907C9DE9A7DD.description:
During shared reading activities, ask and
answer questions about details presented orally or through
other media.

552B508B528B4BAEB71B7266C6A2D826.description:
Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed
about the topics and texts under discussion.

D505DDEA08CB47D4977847B127FCCEA6.description:
Build on others’ talk in conversations by linking their
comments to the remarks of others.

87BEC72869B54B1C9C73B031F5B79128.description:
Engage in multiple-turn exchanges with peers with
support from an adult.

A77420AF04604114A886BEB0B8179B9D.description:
Participate in conversations with adults and
peers.

CC6416ECD17D471FB046B2E2EBF614DE.description:
Identify information related to personal
experiences and answer simple questions about those
experiences.

BEC278F6727A4D6E8404501DDBC8DE0C.description:
Participate in shared research and writing
projects.

B0BDC74004FE4C7B8FC3F20DED020F04.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

71D66FB727964DE99AE089269E53E814.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, use technology (including assistive technologies) to
produce and publish writing.

3F9CBFA6686447BAA19958047FDAA034.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, add more information to own drawing, dictation, or
writing to strengthen the message.

6786787B742849B88204CE8AA2DB7925.description:
Select an event or personal experience and use
drawing, writing, or dictating to compose a message about it.

A41C486DE4564C9CB1EB831595E56A53.description:
Select a topic and use drawing, dictating, or
writing to compose a message with one fact about the topic.

6E7C68CB84B8455A8745522FED6E8657.description:
Select a book and write, draw, or dictate to
state an opinion about it.

D8B13A5D20C4442DA9E3A46D904AAFF2.description: Read familiar text comprised of known words.

52E7EE889DEF4BC2B0BABFE15D03EC32.description:
Identify letter sound correspondence for single
consonants.

09AFC2F6BD764615A97B10B590F42A99.description: Identify the lower case letters of the alphabet.

1A69EAD234F04F1DAC64DB081FB269FA.description:
Demonstrate emerging use of letter-sound
knowledge to read words.

7C21B3E6731F4E519E823003EC3920C6.description:
Actively engage in shared reading of
informational text including history/SS, science, and technical
texts.

B57CED8A1E6447229B38FE1783097249.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

59EFF29DE12A4A50824922B058ACA3B4.description:
Identify a common element between two texts
on the same topic.

011FD8B9C0994086AFC47CAC7FF284EC.description:
Identify points the author makes in an
informational text.

9783A99B91CA475D9B78E9B969F422DA.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual
information that go with a text.

8415C751CEDB48F5900FA745824F7FF2.description: Identify the role of the author and the illustrator.

68670E366B1F4EA5AF97A938C313F96D.description:
Identify details in informational text or its
graphic representations.

113FE64BADEF49B99A76B5FD6135FCCC.description: Identify words related to a topic of a text.

2B42920548514A348F8AA66F3A26B556.description:
Identify individuals, events, or details in an
informational text.

F05EE59581484FE19F22899C6B5F01C0.description: Identify the topic of the text.

FB487A3D18A7473B8AB1B47C9B0451E8.description:
Answer who and what questions to
demonstrate understanding of details in a familiar text.

72BC2E92923E45F2851BB3C94CA9AB2A.description:
Actively engage in shared reading of stories
and poetry for clearly stated purposes.

A18F93CE21D941D189B1DA03A838035E.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

5883206282124A509B33377F078A3A61.description:
Identify similarities between two episodes in a
story.

C790AD9DE18A4E3780BE983803460357.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual
information in print or digital text that depict characters.

AF5087B709244F678E1D7E7B5580AE10.description: Identify the speakers in a dialogue.

6DD48DBA060748F09E61749C6C7059B1.description:
Determine the beginning and ending of a
familiar story with a logical order.

D5164B58728745E8824E391D0BA3720A.description:
Use rhyming or repetition to identify words that
meaningfully complete a familiar story, poem, or song.

B996A432B96D4C29A4F51B62865A4EE4.description: Identify the actions of the characters in a story.

E2F536B8CA324AD0B859E7FC9171713F.description:
Using details from the text, recount events
from familiar stories from diverse cultures.

A379E4F723E84A55A07C8295735B9DD7.description:
Answer who and where questions to
demonstrate understanding of details in a familiar text.
